intro: Eduandrea selloana, commonly known as the Sello's hakea, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae, which is characterized by its diverse and often showy floral structures. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring woody stems and dense, needle-like leaves. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, often displaying a range of colors from white to pink. Eduandrea selloana is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient component of its native ecosystems.
